website_summaries.verdict: The Acer Aspire One Cloudbook 14 is an inexpensive laptop that leverages cloud services like a chromebook. And since it runs Windows 10, all of your legacy apps and plug-ins will still work.
pros: Windows 10 system for a nice price
Comes with one-year subscription to Office 365 and OneDrive
Almost 14 hours of battery life in testing

customer_reviews.title: Good for College students.
customer_reviews.text: Got this computer for my Niece graduating High School, to use for collage. She like it. I told her it suppose to have a long battery life, enough to last the whole day and night. And it boots up fast, so you don't have to wait for it so long to take notes when your class start. So far she likes it. Size is just right, light weight, and form is like a MacBook. I think the 64G is way better then a 32G laptop, because of the OS, and programs. I told her let me know when the memory fills up, I'll buy an SD card. You can just put your files in the SD card anyways.
customer_reviews.author: BlitzSRM

customer_reviews.title: Light with Nice Display not a FireBreather
customer_reviews.text: Nice display and features for not much money. I did not get the Office because I use LibreOffice probably could give them money instead of MicroSoft. Windows 10 is not that annoying, I just got this to do a couple things where I have to use Windows or a Mac. It is nice looking but bendable so take it easy, but no hard drive so thin and light. I have never "put it through its paces" but this is not a high performance machine, I do not do more that run one or two applications at a time. Would not recommend for "power users".
customer_reviews.author: Stuart IMHO

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, great battery life
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard, great battery life, it has 12 hours, performance weak, maybe it is weaker than some smartphone, but the price is very very cheap, if you need more performance and long battery, you sould look up xps 15(powerful monster), macbook air(light), and lenovo x260(the longest battery, if you choose 3cell&6cell)
customer_reviews.author: sonh gal

customer_reviews.title: It has 10-12 hours per battery charge-- a fantastic amount. And the keyboard *is* the best for ...
customer_reviews.text: I only wanted the machine to write, maybe a little Internet searching, a little e-mail; but I really just wanted to use it to write. As the keyboard got an outstanding review, the machine is so inexpensive I thought I'd give it a try. It has 10-12 hours per battery charge-- a fantastic amount. And the keyboard *is* the best for a writer that I've tried after a few dozen. I wol dbuy this again in a heartbeat
customer_reviews.author: Greg Max

customer_reviews.title: Great for school
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my daughter for school. Does everything she needs it to do. May not be the fastest in the world but is fast enough to get the job done. And the battery lasts twice as long as other laptops. Runs cool and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: onetimergoal

customer_reviews.title: Nice Portable Feather Light Lap Top
customer_reviews.text: I like the slim feel and the light weight of this device. It boots quickly and works flawlessly for my web surfing and email activities. I like the usb 3.0 port as well for accessing a portable hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Mike-NewBernNC

customer_reviews.title: It's a really good laptop at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: It's a really good laptop at a reasonable price. I use it for my work, basically write documents and search in the web. The best is the battery: 10-11 hours writing in ms word, searching in the web and listening music. I don't use it for videos (I prefer the tv). The trackpad might be better. The laptop has a thin, light wight, pretty-look chasis, and I can leave the AC cable at home, the battery will last all day long I'm satisfied with this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Julio Reátegui

customer_reviews.title: A great laptop for the price, and a great battery life as well
customer_reviews.text: A great, little computer for the price. Very thin, and a great battery life (around 8 hours on the lowest settings). It can't handle too many tabs at once, or other multitasking, but it is a good deal for the price. I've been using this laptop for the past two years, and it is still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great computer for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my daughter for Christmas she loves it great price and with the SSD drive much faster than the old computer it was replacing. She is able to do everything she needs to do on this and it is super light weight. She is very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Pittman

customer_reviews.title: A keeper !
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my son who says he's happy with it but he did not give it five stars as the screen brightness is a bit on the dim side and the system could use a bit more speed, but those are minor problems, according to him. MY opinion is that for the price you won't find anything nearly as good with specs like that out there. Thank you Acer.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Great value PC
customer_reviews.text: Very light, well build, very long battery life. Track pad is amazing - very responsive and operates way better than track pads on my two other very expensive laptops. So far so good. Over all - very good PC for little money.
customer_reviews.author: VOVA

customer_reviews.title: Super light. Attractive casing
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is extraordinary. Super light. Attractive casing. Not as fast as a higher priced model, but it does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Talkington

customer_reviews.title: Review on "Acer Aspire One Cloudbook, 14-inch HD, 64GB"
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit slow, not much CPU power; besides that, it is pretty good for traveling, e-mail, watching internet flicks, etc... It is very light.
customer_reviews.author: 4 Peace

customer_reviews.title: There may not be a better laptop for the money
customer_reviews.text: Amazing laptop for the money. Bought this for my 12 year old son and he loves it. Works great and utilizes cloud backup so your work is always safe.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy C

customer_reviews.title: Acer surpased my expectations
customer_reviews.text: This computer is getting the job done. I bought it for school especially when I am not home and away from my desktop. However I find myself using it even at home. It came with Microsoft Office for a year which I plan on purchasing when my time is up. I do not use the cloud but I plan on doing so in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Acer
customer_reviews.text: It is perfect for what what we needed it for. Great size and weight.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Good at its targeted use
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic economy netbook. Has issues as noted in other reviews, gets 5 stars for my use. Larger keyboard/display and greater storage/memory make this far more versatile than the smaller brother. If compact is required, use the 11 inch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More than what I bargained for.....
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this cloud book! It does EXACTLY what I need for work. I have not had any issues with speed. Note: I will only be using this cloud book for work over the internet and with Microsoft Office and to socialize on Facebook/Twitter. This cloud book would be perfect for students and people who work outside of an office a lot and utilize the Internet to submit their work.
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: Better than the smaller version
customer_reviews.text: This larger 14 inch version is much better than the smaller version. The keyboard layout is much better, especially the right shift key.
customer_reviews.author: KindleUser

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for students.
customer_reviews.text: Fast, light, very nice laptop for simple work. Keyboard feels nice. Doing homeworks on this laptop does not feel as much of a chore.
customer_reviews.author: Chau

customer_reviews.title: Battery was shot in 3.5 Months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop in September, and by January the battery was shot. I could only use it while it was plugged in and if it turned off I had to charge it for 2+ hours before being able to log back in. It has an internal battery so you can't replace the battery
customer_reviews.author: Regina Jones

customer_reviews.title: This is a great value! Price of 239 dollars each
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value! Price of 239 dollars each. It is a windows based laptop made for working online and storing on the cloud or an external hard drive. This is a fast machine, we love it!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bedwell

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my daughter to do her homework and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter to do her homework and she was able to set it up with ease. She loves this cloudbook.
customer_reviews.author: Nikky B

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting anything mind blowing, it only had 2gb ram after all, but that's not what worried me. I bought this for school. Something light, just for typing papers and other documents. It seems like the keyboard cannot keep up with fast typing and misses letters a spaces. This is somewhat disappointing because all I needed this for was typing. I'll just have to remember to hit the space key in the middle and type at a steady pace. I would recommend this to a student who wants a budget little network but if you need to do a lot of typing I'd look elswhere.
customer_reviews.author: W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Comes loaded with bloatware, so prepare to remove it quickly. Once cleaned up, it's a nice portable laptop with a great battery. Biggest limitation is the memory, but as long as you are not a big multitasker it will be fine once cleaned up. Remove all the Mcaffee and Avast junk and stick with Microsoft built in free Windows Defender, much lighter weight and sufficient for most.
customer_reviews.author: Berardi

customer_reviews.title: Best economic labtop
customer_reviews.text: This includes 1 year subscription office which is nice. This is like a steal. Makes no noise and low heat.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Ju

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this computer. It's simple and easy to use and nothing too fancy which is what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barajas

customer_reviews.title: Battery doesn't last too long and its a bit slow ...
customer_reviews.text: Battery doesn't last too long and its a bit slow in processing things, but it completely works for our purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hasenkamp

customer_reviews.title: It didnt last a year.
customer_reviews.text: This Computer was purchased and Shipped on March 15, 2016. Today is Jan. 3,2017 and the computer just died. Taking it to Greek Squad but they said it didnt look good to able to repair. Worked great until it just would not open up in screen. Screen was grey.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It went dead after two weeks unfortunately I had send ...
customer_reviews.text: It went dead after two weeks unfortunately I had send it to Africa and they have not been able to ship it back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Awful experience with this laptop. Would not turn on after two uses....sent back for refund
customer_reviews.author: 3ndns

customer_reviews.title: great laptop but has a very strange curser pad
customer_reviews.text: great laptop but has a very strange curser pad. It is hard to figure out right click and pressure for it. Had to just get an external mouse because it was so frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Vandy Scoates

customer_reviews.title: 10 out of 10
customer_reviews.text: works great! wasn't sure when I bought it if it was really a great one. but I have it and it's very nice and quick. setting it up was very easy
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a good laptop to start. It is very responsive and works and feel good.
customer_reviews.author: Perez

customer_reviews.title: 18 hours+ with dim screen and wifi off for simple word processing
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic little linux box (after getting rid of windows) for portability and long life. I think I get a consistent 10-12 hours of normal use, inclusive of a lot of youtube and compiling of code. If I am simply using it to code or ssh and dim the screen to about 25%, the hours can jump to over 18 according to the estimations of ubuntu power analysis. It is slow though when looking at code running, but web browsing and basic document editing has very limited lag. You get what you pay for, a long lasting netbook.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price you pay
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price you pay. Very light and long battery life. It's a little on the slow side...but will be more than sufficient for browsing and running Microsoft office.
customer_reviews.author: Yi En Huang

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Graduation gift for my grandaughter. Picked out by her Daddy. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to souly use on my car for msd racepak and nos controller all programs work great on it very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like it quite a bit, but, trackpad bites. I use a mouse and it's all good...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Standby/Sleep Time.
customer_reviews.text: I like the laptop. Yes, it's slow, but that's to be expected with a computer in this price range. As indicated in the description, the battery does last a very long time during constant use, that's the major reason I got this model. However, standby time is simply terrible! I put the computer to sleep and the battery continues to discharge at a really rapid rate. I cannot get more than two days of standby time, even without using the computer. I don't know if maybe I got a defective model, maybe other people are not having the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Tadzio

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for anyone looking to do office based tasks/apps on the go
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for a friend who has not used a computer before. Works perfectly and was very easy for him to learn to use after the 10 minute basic tutorial I gave him on using Windows 10. Perfect for anyone looking to do office based tasks/apps on the go, or need/want internet access while on the go. Great little device for the money, and the 14' screen is non glare which is really nice too.
customer_reviews.author: CDH

customer_reviews.title: Buy it knowing it isn't powerful, keep it because of the battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knowing it wasn't powerful, but if power isn't a concern for you but rather battery life is, then this is perfect! [After a hassle] I installed Linux Mint (xfce) onto this and away I went with almost no issues (Brightness keys issue).
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellend laptop for the price - go for the 64GB version
customer_reviews.text: Love this. The 14inch version with Windows 10 Home and 64GB storage. Works well for everyday use. Browsing and MS Office works works flawlessly. A bit heavy but the 64GB storage is worth the extra weight and size. Would have loved if the 11inch came with the extra storage. Always a good idea to get rid of the junk pre-installed. Just get rid of the stuff you think you'll not need. I removed the Anti Virus software from McAfee and installed Windows Defender. Installed Chrome and browsing was fantastic. HD video and YouTube playback works well. Netflix works fine too. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: I. Fairooz

customer_reviews.title: We purchased this for our toddlers to use for ABC ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our toddlers to use for ABC Mouse (online learning program). Work very well for the price point and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: MattCB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I needed a laptop for school and my business. very light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Mom knows best

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Aspire One Cloud book for my wife and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: E.J. Mack

customer_reviews.title: Thanks but no cigar
customer_reviews.text: I find it very hard to believe that anyone would find the performance of this laptop acceptable running Windows 10 and having more than one app running at a time. My needs aren't that heavy, but come on! this is a severely underpowered machine. Having said all that, I did like the form factor and while I found the plastic edges a little too sharp, the feel wasn't all that bad and the keyboard was above average. I could not recommend this laptop even for my kids to use, though it is cheap enough that if they dropped it it wouldn't break the bank to replace.
customer_reviews.author: MiamiMe

customer_reviews.title: The screen went black after a couple months of use ...
customer_reviews.text: The screen went black after a couple months of use. A common hardware problem. Don't buy, get another computer from dell with the same battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The slowest laptop I have ever owned. I use ...
customer_reviews.text: The slowest laptop I have ever owned. I use it to create powerpoint and word documents also some light websurfing. I cannot do any of these without lags. SUCKS
customer_reviews.author: Shin

customer_reviews.title: Good device, light and fast to boot up
customer_reviews.text: Good device, light and fast to boot up. Worked well for 27 days, but then battery gave up and won't charge. Looks like Acer has some issues with battery failure. Sending it back for refund. Irritating.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really love my Acer, I am learning more as I go. It is great...
customer_reviews.author: Sally  Croy

customer_reviews.title: Not great, but not bad. Windows, & larger screen, but below average elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: this is a decent cheap computer with a worse than average screen. I bought a 10" Acer Chromebook for a similar price. The screen was smaller & it has the limited chrome os, which is just a tweaked chrome browser. But the screen was better, that unit has a touchscreen, and it has the best trackpad I've ever used on a laptop. This unit has none of those features, but it does have Windows, so i's not as limited as the Chromebook.
customer_reviews.author: ThisIsNotMy"RealName(TM)"

customer_reviews.title: Slow
customer_reviews.text: Slowest computer ever. Good idea but it is painfully slow if you are used to computer response times of the 21st century
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Chambers

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Slow and just clunky. The bloatware was awful and I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie J.

customer_reviews.title: The chromebooks are infinitely better and far faster
customer_reviews.text: This computer is the slowest computer I have ever used. Although there is a MIcrosoft program called ReadyBoost which theoretically can speed up a computer, it does NOT work on this device. The Acer cloudbook is a cheap imitation of the Google chromebooks. The chromebooks are infinitely better and far faster.The downside of chromebooks is that they are not compatible with many Microsoft (and other) software programs. This gadget, although it is a Microsoft device, runs too slowly to perform any type of task.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Not good for photo editing!
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad laptop for searching the web and watching movies. Storage is limited and this laptop is useless for photo editing! Downloaded Lightroom on this laptop and it's so slow, I had to go back to the desktop to edit.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Brooks

customer_reviews.title: There are much better options out there for similar price
customer_reviews.text: I made a big mistake buying this product. Fair enough, I was looking for a cheaper laptop, I accept that, but this is a horrendous machine. Never have I used a slower laptop. The track pad seems to do as it pleases, even switching between windows seems an effort for this machine. Please, don't buy it. There are much better options out there for similar price. Makes me sad that I have to give it a star at all, it doesn't deserve one.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Too slow for me
customer_reviews.text: I really do not enjoy this laptop, I'm great with technology and had some extra money. I've never owned a laptop so I decided I would just throw down 200 dollars and get one, but this thing is beyond slow
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hubert

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was very happy until she used this. It started glitching in the first few minutes, so we packed it right up and sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Belle

customer_reviews.title: I did not enjoy using this "cloud"book
customer_reviews.text: I did not enjoy using this "cloud"book. The microsoft edge browser is horrible, all it does is lags. There is no speed. I will be going back to a "chrome"book, I feel the chrome web browser is extremely smoother.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Acer Aspire One Cloudbook, 14-Inch HD, 64GB, Windows 10, Gray (AO1-431-C7F9) includes Office 365 Personal – 1 year
product_meta.description:
Acer Aspire One Cloud book 14 AO1-431-C7F9 comes with these high level specs: Intel Celeron N3050 Dual-Core Processor 1.6GHz with Intel Burst Technology up to 2.16GHz, Windows 10, 14" HD Widescreen LED-backlit Display (1366x768 resolution; 16:9 aspect ratio), Intel HD Graphics, 2GB DDR3L Onboard Memory, 64GB Internal Storage, Secure Digital (SD) card reader, 802.11ac WiFi (Dual-Band 2.4GHz and 5GHz), Bluetooth 4.0, Built-In Webcam, 1 - USB 3.0 Port, 1 - USB 2.0 Port, 1 - HDMI Port, 3-cell Li-polymer battery pack (4780 mAh), Up to 12-hours Battery Life (Video Playback), 3.53 lbs. | 1.6 kg (system unit only), Microsoft Office 365 Personal 1-Year Subscription (activation code included) (NX.SHGAA.003)

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: 14-Inch HD Screen, Intel HD Graphics, 12-hour battery life

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars127 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
